title.rendered: A bunch of Android phone companies are developing this extraterrestrial feature!

content.rendered: Xiaomi, OPPO and a host of other smartphone manufacturers are trying their best to bring satellite communication technology to their future smartphones. This information comes from an announcement by Qualcomm at the MWC 2023 event in Barcelona. Let’s find out more with Pitoko! The chip giant has announced that Xiaomi, Vivo, Motorola, OPPO, Honor and Nothing are working on bringing satellite communication technology to their mobile devices. The company confirmed that Android OEMs are working on adding satellite communications as Apple did with the iPhone 14 series, but it’s still unclear when brands will roll out the feature. Previously, Qualcomm announced the new “Snapdragon Satellite” technology that it is partnering with satellite service provider – Iridium during CES 2023. So obviously Xiaomi, Motorola and other brands too. This service will be available soon. According to the official announcement, Snapdragon Satellite will be available on upcoming RF modems and multiple models of 8 and 4 series processors for smartphones. “Incorporating Snapdragon Satellite into future devices will enable our partners to provide satellite messaging capabilities thanks to the constellation,” said Francesco Grilli, Qualcomm’s vice president of product management. LEO star, and allows users around the world to communicate with family, friends, and emergency service providers wherever they are.”
